s.text: But they have chosen not to attack, perhaps because they are waiting to produce an effect even greater than the 9/11 attacks, so they do not appear to be losing strength.
And I think this is what they are waiting for.

This website and everything on it is in the Public Domain, so you may use it freely, even without attribution.
Is this "negotiating with terrorists" or "trying to appease the terrorists," as some Israeli/NeoCons would try to say?
Is this "negotiating with terrorists" or "trying to appease the terrorists," as some Israeli/NeoCons would try to say?

And the second-greatest terrorist threat comes from several countries, mainly Israel, who sometimes resort to terrorism themselves, claiming "self-defense," as they desperately try to prevent further attacks by radical Muslims.

We try to be even-handed in opposing all terrorism, although we recognize that the greatest terrorist threat in the world today comes from radical Muslims who falsely believe that Allah approves of their criminal behavior against Israel, The United States, Russia, India, the Philippines, Australia, and others whom they falsely believe to be "waging war against Allah.
By trying to "stamp out" terrorism by killing terrorists, Bush and Israel have made things infinitely worse for us: more dangerous, not safer.
True, the USA has not suffered a successful major attack since 9/11, but this does not mean that we are safer.
True, the USA has not suffered a successful major attack since 9/11, but this does not mean that we are safer.
The terrorists could strike any time they choose, through any of the numerous loopholes so well reported in our media.
But this claim is merely feel-good propaganda, intended to keep the neo-cons in power.
TERRORISM is "the systematic use of violence to create a general climate of fear in a population and thereby to bring about a particular political objective.

Now, many more moderate Muslims have become radicalized, world-wide, willing to kill innocent civilians in order to achieve their purposes.
If the terrorist loses faith in the righteousness of his acts, he is less likely to perform them.
But they have chosen not to attack, perhaps because they are waiting to produce an effect even greater than the 9/11 attacks, so they do not appear to be losing strength.

Brute force has failed in Palestine, and it is failing in Iraq.
We completely reject the idea that terrorism can be defeated by brute force, because brute force radicalizes the moderates, and they then join the terrorists.
We completely reject the idea that terrorism can be defeated by brute force, because brute force radicalizes the moderates, and they then join the terrorists.
In every case of terrorism, we will find some kind of legitimate underlying grievance.
A big picture of our entire Anti-Terrorism strategy can be found at our website => http://www.loveallpeople.org/defeatingterrorism.html .
